H0.text: Models are useful tools that help scientists work with, understand, and make predictions about extremely complex systems.

H1.text: Guesses are a useful tool that helps scientists work with, understand, and make predictions about extremely complex systems.

H2.text: Assumptions are a useful tool that helps scientists work with, understand, and make predictions about extremely complex systems.

H3.text: Speculation is a useful tool that helps scientists work with, understand, and make predictions about extremely complex systems.

A4.text: models that are rendered in software allow scientists to leverage computational power to simulate, visualize, manipulate and gain intuition about the entity, phenomenon, or process being represented.

A5.text: Scientific modelling is an activity that produces models representing empirical objects, phenomena, and physical processes, to make a particular part or feature of the world easier to understand, define, quantify, visualize, or simulate.
